content:
# The results show that all furnaces are currently out of fuel and have no ingredients to smelt. 
# Their statuses indicate "NO_INGREDIENTS," confirming that they cannot operate without coal or other materials.

# My inventory remains unchanged, with 5 coal, 5 stone, 2 iron ore, 4 iron plates, and 5 iron gear wheels. 
# Since I have some coal in my inventory, I can refuel one or more of the furnaces to enable them to start smelting again.

# I will distribute some coal to the furnaces to get them operational. 
# Let's allocate 2 units of coal to each furnace that is currently inactive.

# Refueling the furnaces
for furnace in entities:
    if furnace.name == 'stone-furnace' and inspect_inventory(furnace).get(Prototype.Coal, 0) == 0:
        insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=2)  # Insert coal into the furnace
        print(f"Inserted coal into furnace at position {furnace.position}.")

# After refueling, I will check the updated statuses of the furnaces and my inventory again.
print(f"Updated Inventory after refueling furnaces: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Verify the inventory after inserting coal
final_furnace_statuses_after_refuel = [inspect_inventory(f) for f in entities if f.name == 'stone-furnace']  # Inspect all furnaces' inventories
print(f"Final Furnace statuses after refueling: {final_furnace_statuses_after_refuel}")  # Display states of all furnaces after refueling
